website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for affordable locks for luggage and other minor security needs, they are acceptable. But other models we reviewed have more to offer on many fronts.
pros: Reliable, travel-friendly locks that can be easily removed and replaced by TSA agents
usable for other lock needs besides luggage
Value priced w/a a 3-year replacement warranty
cons: Provides some security, but can be cut
not ideal for serious security needs
Combination code is a bit difficult to set
Hasps are too thick for some luggage pieces

customer_reviews.title: NOOo!  Lock code can be reset even when locked, by anyone!
customer_reviews.text: No, these are just wrong. Zero protection! You can change the lock code while the lock is locked! Seriously, you lock it, someone pushes in the reset button, places their code in, the lock opens. Then your stuck with the unknown code from the person who just opened it. Not to worry, push the reset button in and put in another code, it opens. Most of these types of locks have to be open to change the code. Not these. Seriously, anyone can change the lock code at anytime by just pushing reset.
customer_reviews.author: parrotale

customer_reviews.title: Good lock for multi zippered backpacks
customer_reviews.text: Since I don't have spare eyes to watch the backpack zippers when I travel, this is the solution. The trick is to line the zipper pulls up as close as possible to each other then use this lock. It helps to have a bit of cable length since they don't all line up in the same area. The weight is negligible, and the item price is more reasonable than the other shopping site that starts with e and ends with Bay. Any deterrent is to your advantage when foiling criminals.
customer_reviews.author: =DAVE=

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: These locks are just what we needed for backpacking abroad. For small locks They have a good secure weight to them, but still light enough for travel. The metal wire is pretty long which is nice for locking up more than just one zipper. They worked for locking things in lockers at hostels as well as locking some zippered pockets on our backpacking bags. The price was perfect, saw the same lock in the airport and one was the same price as this double pack. Easy to set your code. I think these locks will last quite a while! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Carajan

customer_reviews.title: Terrrible quality control - one of two doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Of the two in the "2-pack", one worked after resetting the combination. The other one opened once after resetting the combination, then wouldn't open again. It seems to be able to line-up in-between numbers as well as on the numbers themselves, but I tried every little combination of notches before and after the one I reset to, and none would open. Only then did I realize the large number of other reviewers here that had the same problem. I'm just glad I had the problem now at home rather than while traveling and not be able to get my luggage open! Returning these.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. R.

customer_reviews.title: After a few uses, locks up
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was excited to use this, as the landscapers tended to mess with my pool pump timer frequently. I used this to lock my pump timer box closed, and for the first few times I had to open it.. it was great! Then the lock started getting harder to open when correct combo was set. Finally, I'm now unable to even depress the reset button or get the combo to work and will need to figure out how to break the lock off. Not worth it. I can only imagine how much quicker these will break when they're used on luggage and subjected to the abuse and mishandling the airport luggage sorters put on them.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Harding

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy for carry-on
customer_reviews.text: These are way heavier than I expected. Had found different locks in the store that were super light but decided to buy on Amazon instead. Unfortunately, these are way too heavy for carry-on while traveling in Europe. When your bag can only be 16pds, you definitely need to keep to reduce every ounce you can! The description says 64g, I think, but my luggage scale is showing 150g. But honestly, they feel even heavier than that to me. Sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: A GREAT Aunt

customer_reviews.title: Terrible locks, worthless even.
customer_reviews.text: Word to the wise- DO NOT purchase these if you don't want things stolen from you. I have three Pelican type cases in which I placed two of these locks on each, and they were all very quickly pulled off and broken. I would return them, but the window for that opportunity closed a little over two weeks ago and the locks were broken into a few days ago. Bummer! They're just worthless. (And I made the mistake of purchasing multiples!)
customer_reviews.author: Bruin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard to use and set-up - TSA lock, Bad user experience...
customer_reviews.text: I think the pricing and the mechanism of this tool are great and maybe this could be me being incompetent but for some reason, I am not able to get these locked set-ups. I didn't get to use this tool until at this point but I didn't realize how difficult it would be to set it up. After ten minutes of following the instruction and trying to reset the tool, I couldn't so now the tool is practically useless. The lock itself looks decent for quality but what does the lock do if you can't even set it up.... Change your user manual and I am sure this will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: ConsultantinNY

customer_reviews.title: Great small flexible locks
customer_reviews.text: Great easy combination locks. Even after you enter the correct combination, you have to press a button to release the cable. I like that. I read at least two reviews saying that the combination can be changed while the lock is closed, but I found that to be true only when the numbers are already set to the prior code. For ex: if your code is 343 and the lock is set to 343, the combination can be changed whether the lock is open or closed. If the code is 343, and the lock is set to, say, 459, you can't change the code to a new one while the lock is closed.
customer_reviews.author: LovnLif79

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Choose These Locks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent locks. Perfect for so many different applications. I'm using them for my ammunition boxes, but they'd great for other uses around the house. With the covered cable they won't scratch when used around paint, wood, material or plastics. The flexible wire is al so a plus even if you going to use them just for luggage.
customer_reviews.author: J Alexandra Hooper

customer_reviews.title: ... bought these for a backpacking trip and they worked great, and now I continue to use them for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a backpacking trip and they worked great, and now I continue to use them for my gym locker. I locked/unlocked both several times a day for nearly 2 weeks and they hold up great, no signs of wear. While someone with cable cutters could certainly get into them, they are very sturdy and so should work for most situations. Definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works But It Doesn't
customer_reviews.text: This was my third purchase for this type of lock. I at times struggle to get it to unlock using the correct combination. I realized I get what I paid for but small things like this shouldn't malfunction subsequent to following the directions on setting the combination. In fact, the combination code to the past two purchases are the same for this. It is just this one padlock out of two that does not work. I need two padlocks to secure a something simple despite this something simple is also put in a storage.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to set at first
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it for traveling, only to keep my son out of the candy cupboard. Setting the combination the first time is very, very difficult. I realize that this can be an excellent feature, but it is so difficult that I've only managed to put a new combination on one of the locks. The other lock is still on the combination that it came with. Hence taking one star off. One note: to lock it again, you have to hold down the button before inserting the wire.
customer_reviews.author: MBM

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, instructions for comibation change are poor
customer_reviews.text: Terrible locks, we were never able to change the combination, we attempted and it seems it took some random combination in the process and thefore the lock ended up locking without us being able to open it ever again. Didn't even try using the other, just tossed them in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Great for locking up areas and more convenient than using a keyed padlock
customer_reviews.text: Great little lock for areas that need to be secure because of little ones getting into things. I don't know how sturdy they would be if you were trying to keep outdoor areas safe from thieves but they do the job when you want to keep cleaning supplies locked away from little ones and it's much more convenient than using a padlock and carrying around a key. Remembering three numbers is much easier than locating a misplaced key.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Blagg

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these. They come open. Mine have twice come open when traveling. And no, it wasn't opened by the TSA agent. Nobody went into my bag but the lock was open when it arrived on the carousel at the airport. The same thing happened to my traveling companion but her lock was lost. Mine did not get lost because it was secured with a zip tie. Look for a different lock!
customer_reviews.author: J Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Reset feature defeats the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the gym, but it would be so easy for someone to just reset and open if they knew what to look for. Kind of defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: sunnyteacher

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I needed locks for two large, plastic cases going in my studio at school and these work perfectly, the loop lengths were just enough. Padlock loops either weren't long enough or were just unwieldy make it hard to get back off but these were a good solution. Additionally, It was extremely easy to set the combination.
customer_reviews.author: kristina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a suitcase after TSA broke my TSA lock on a suitcase. Works great and since there are two, I was able to use the other lock on a smaller suitcase that did not have a TSA lock. Only thing is, mine did not come with instructions on how to set the combination. I had to use watch a YouTube video! No biggie, easy to set after I watched the video online. The quality seems great.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Also works for cabinet doors!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these because of the long cable to lock cabinet doors closed. It just barely fits, but it works great. I wanted to be able to lock them from the outside so adults could access the cabinets, but children who have outgrown child safety latches could not. Super easy and not a terrible pain (outside of the terrible pain of child locks in general) They get used more than a typical luggage lock would and are holding up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work, unfortunately out of the 2 pack, one of mine was defective. I was unable to reset the code to my own, yet it wouldn't open prior, so it was just a dead lock. Unable to open it period, kind of funny in a way guess that means it gets 4 stars for security features. The other one, I was able to change to my code but after using it once, the same thing happened as the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Megan A.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to have a way to unlock if the password is forgotten. The reset button didn't work. I ended up needing to use a heavy duty wire cutter to get it off. Won't be using these again. Wish I had read the reviews first.
customer_reviews.author: The Dav

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set, not! Fools thieves, not!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions to reset are impossible for a 68 year old to read since they are so small. Operating the reset the button is similarly difficult. I did not realize the the reset button is exposed for anyone to use. This is one of the most ill designed products I have seen. Now I doubt Amazon's ability to maintain valid ratings. I cannot believe there are so many 5 star ratings. Shame on me for trusting them
customer_reviews.author: T. P. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for kid's clue solving party
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my daughter's classroom Christmas party. We solved a mystery that involved using clues to find the combination for these locks. That being said, these locks are awesome! The long latch makes it very easy to use them with pretty much anything. Changing the combination was super easy. I will definitely use these for my own suitcase when traveling from now on. Plus the price point was perfect. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R. Dilldine

customer_reviews.title: Great product, get these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on motorcycle soft saddlebags just to keep folks from opening the zippers. These are not designed to be high security but work perfectly for bags and to stop snoopers. Their operation initially is a little bit hard to figure out because the instructions are sparse, but it is not rocket science. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT forget to open lock b4 resetting for new combo
customer_reviews.text: elegant solution to the tsa lock problem, no more little keys to fret about/lose. Once figured out how to reset lock to my code (3 numbers) , very easy to handle, remember, numbers are offset to the little arrow below the center line no instructions for the obvious. can not reset to set combo w/out opening lock first.,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot dial combination setup
customer_reviews.text: Good that I purchased these merely as a decoy , simply to appear that I had a locked lock in my shovel handle attachment holes , since I could not move the roller combination dials to set it . So , it is permanently on 0-0-0 , and appears to be locked . Served it's decoy purpose , although Not it's intended purpose .
customer_reviews.author: oldtora

customer_reviews.title: A no-brainer for travelling
customer_reviews.text: A great feature of these travel locks are their size and flexibility -- the wires make it very easy to weave together things intricately. I recently returned from a four week trek through Europe and I've attached these to many things for security throughout the trip: hostel lockers, room keys, backpack zippers, camera straps, plenty of things! They're lightweight and durable enough to deter people from messing with your belongings. With two in the pack, this is a great value and a great investment for security while travelling!
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: No need to look further!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment complex where they supply very little extra storage space. The space we have been able to take, however, is totally open and free for whoever and whatever to get in freely; unless you have a lock! That's where these little babies came in. For being so small, they are extremely sturdy and trustworthy. The instructions are clear and easy to set up! They have actually made living here a lot less stressful. :D
customer_reviews.author: I. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Good for use on a backpack
customer_reviews.text: I am traveling overseas with a backpack and wanted a way to secure the zippers to deter theft and pick-pockets. I love the flexible connector that allows for more range and movement. It fits well on my backpack. It was very easy to setup and use. My only complaint is that it is a little heavy, but hopefully that means it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Setting up the Combination - I finally read and followed the directions!!
customer_reviews.text: I was confused at first on how to change the combination. I was confused between the Reset button on the bottom (easily pressed in with a golf tee) and the Release button on the side. When I read and followed the directions, these were easy to set up. It's not the lock's fault, but I am not persuaded that people other than TSA have keys, so it's not all the secure for checked luggage. But it's better than nothing. Baggage handlers must have TSA keys, don't you think? Probably okay for casual thieves in hotels.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorman

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday locks. But don't fall for the TSA approved lart
customer_reviews.text: I have 8 of these right now. I have had 2 cut by TSA to open my bags. A TSA guy told me that they never try to open a lock. They just cut it. So I am having the locks just so that the zippers don't open randomely. You'd better have some with you for your return flight in case TSA cuts them on the first flight. I use it in my lab to lock the cabinets too. They are good everyday locks. But very easy to cut. You can cut them by almost any tool that you find.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little lock that enables you to choose your own 3 numbers to unlock. Only drawback for me is I use it when I swim. The first time I put my glasses in locker and had to get someone else in the locker room to open it as the numbers are very small. Now glasses are brought into pool area! Other than that works fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: 1 still works, 1 never worked
customer_reviews.text: I loved using this TSA Travel Lock. It was easy to set up and easy to use, not bulky so it fits easily in a pocket. When my husband wanted to start using the second one a few months later, it had never been removed from the packaging. I tried to set it up but it just would not work at all. By then it was too late to return it. Expensive for just the one working lock.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser10Mil

customer_reviews.title: Do not use these for Europe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to my brother traveling abroad to Europe. First night at the hostel, the locks were picked off and 400 Euros were stolen. The second night, 500 Euros were gone. Definitely would not recommend to be used in hostels, because apparently they are very easy to be picked on.
customer_reviews.author: Seung Ri Cho

customer_reviews.title: Watch the video
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning them. Don't waste your time. While it's locked anyone can change the combination and then open it. Just watch the video it shows you how to change the combination, while it's in the locked position.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Very useful but with specific needs
customer_reviews.text: That's a magnificent lock. Resistant body and easy to handle the numbers. You gotta be careful with the kind of zipper pulls of your luggage, because depending of it the gap between them could be too big and easy to someone sneak or even take something off your luggage. In this case some luggage has a zipper below the main one that you can attach all togheter. Even though it's a very useful lock.
customer_reviews.author: Khatru

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a briefcase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to lock my briefcase, which had a place for a lock but I could not find a decent one that fit through that area. So, I bought these - they're perfect. Setting them was easy with the directions, they are fairly secure (though obviously not going to withstand, say, bolt cutters. As I basically never let the thing out of sight, anyway, and it's an extra precaution - these were a great deal and serve their purpose well. Slide right through even the overly small holes in my zipper that were designed for I'd guess much older, youth-diary-style locks.
customer_reviews.author: Finley Mox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Smart looking, snappy little locks...a tad heavier than I expected but I guess that's a sign of the quality. Some folks mention that the numbers are hard to read, especially if there's a light shining on them...I merely shaded the numbers with my hand--absolutely no problem after that. A very nice product that looks like it will do exactly what I want it to do--deter snooping thieves. Well-written, easy to follow instructions to help you set the lock are another bonus. I have kept the instructions tucked in my suitcase for reference in the future should I ever want to change the combination.
customer_reviews.author: Faithful in France

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: Got three of this and never could use them. I was able to set the code, open and close it, and then suddenly could not open any of them. I try to reset the code and it does not work. The wire is too thick as well to use on some luggages. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Gin

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I love this little lock. Used it on my backpack while travelling for disaster relief. Its easy to reset the code, easy to open and shut (when you enter the code) and is a perfect little deterrent. It is small and feels light, so if someone was really hellbent on getting into your stuff I think they still may be able to, but for the average thief/nosy roommate, it works great
customer_reviews.author: Kate C

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. So easy to use. My lock that came built into my suitcase was cut by the TSA and I’m sure they had a key for it. But what made me buy this lock is the fact that it’s long enough to reach through the top of the zippers that we’re cut and still be able to lock easily. Plus, it’s so darn easy to open. I’m definitely gonna but a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty woman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, returned
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a bag that has the circular holes on the zipper body (not the "pull tab"). The first lock reset and took my new combination fine, the second one failed during the reset process. Ended up buying small "keyed Master locks instead.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Setting the combination
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is that once you click the cable release button before setting the combination, you can't reset it. I put in a combination after releasing the button and connecting the cable again. No matter what I did, I could not press the reset button down far enough to set a new code. Just don't release the cable before setting a code and it should work.
customer_reviews.author: MUTT WONDERDUCK

customer_reviews.title: So close.
customer_reviews.text: When I got these, I loved them. The cable is long enough to be easy to work with, sturdy enough for travel, and thin enough to fit through lockers. They're easy to handle, and easy to set the combination. Then I took them on travel, and in the low light of a hotel room I had trouble reading the numbers. Imagine me trying to hold my phone so the light would shine on the numbers while spinning the dials. I was hoping it was a one off. But I was in 7 hotels in 2 weeks and I had the problem about half the time. In sufficient light, they're great. In low light, the numbers are really hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I could not open the locks once the new code was entered. The old code did not work. Too late to get a refund. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: They work well and seem a quality build. However ...
customer_reviews.text: They work well and seem a quality build. However, the TSA took them regardless. Even though they are TSA approved. So much for that money, right?
customer_reviews.author: Edward Teach

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This lock was very easy to use on luggage that doesn't zipper lock. You still need to work it around so that zipper doesn't open at least a little bit. Other than that, it is built very strong and works well every time you use it.
customer_reviews.author: BenKaTop Contributor: Clarinets

customer_reviews.title: High quality locks!
customer_reviews.text: High quality locks! It doesn't have a cheap feel to it, it actually feels like it can handle the tossing and turning when your bag goes through the conveyor belt in an airport. Also since it's has a TSA lock, TSA can open it without breaking your lock. Great investment especially for someone who travels a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not very practical
customer_reviews.text: Cable and lock is very small and difficult to manipulate. I suppose there are uses for a locking system this small, but the difficulty in manipulating the small tumblers is too frustrating. There are better solutions to your needs.
customer_reviews.author: CAP

customer_reviews.title: These locks are very easily set with a 3 number combo you choose
customer_reviews.text: Pros: These locks are very easily set with a 3 number combo you choose, The cables are long enough to easily fit on larger luggage and backpacks. Cons: Not a very secure lock, but more of a visual deterrent for anyone wanting to take your bag. The combination can be simply changed by anyone who has done there homework on locks.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki N

customer_reviews.title: one worked great - other arrived with code already set = unusable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these right before a recent trip & the 2-pack arrived with one lock working perfectly, and the other one presumably with the code already set, or defective, as no number of attempts to set the code would work, even after several people tried it. I was leaving in 36 hours for my trip, so no time to return and replace. So I kept them and basically paid double as one was useless and now both are non-returnable. Not exactly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gym Locker and Back Yard lock
customer_reviews.text: I use this for both the gym locker and to lock my back yard. Yes I'm sure someone with the right tools could break it easily but so could they with any other lock. It does the job of making breaking in difficult thus being a deterrent. Works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Amazon Warrior

customer_reviews.title: latch is not properly aligned with numbers
customer_reviews.text: I found that even though I had set up the combination according to the instructions. I could not open the lock. After fiddling with it I discovered that the numbers had to be slightly off center in order to release the lock. Worse yet, each time the amount and location off center was different. I really cannot recommend these locks.
customer_reviews.author: dskdan

customer_reviews.title: Well built.
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised. Stronger than the previous, small model (same brand) I had purchased from a local hardware store. Only concern is that in producing a slightly larger, stronger lock, the head of the cable does not fit through the holes in the zipper pulls designed for such a purpose. Rather, I use the zipper pull handles instead. Not a big deal, and in this case, the larger, stronger lock is preferred.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Staats

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a motorcycle not to long ago. Got a carrier on the back, but it only had the push together clips. Looked at those and thought about a cable lock. I use 1 to keep my carry case locked and use the other for my helmet lock. You can also set your own combination. Tsa can unlock with a key but will not know the code and you will know if they unlocked it by a little red peg on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Richie

customer_reviews.title: Junky design
customer_reviews.text: First order just one of two locks enabled. Poorly made. Sent back and requested replacements. Second order same thing. Could not set up lock on either lock this time. Easy directions but junky design. Returned second set as well.
customer_reviews.author: Houston grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great locks, easy to set code, sturdy cable
customer_reviews.text: These locks are great, easy to set the code and easy to use. I really like the locks that have the cable because you can string it through multiple zippers and secure more than one compartment with one lock! Cost efficient to do it this way. Good value, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: chandiego

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says. Instructions create a fun little puzzle - free bonus.
customer_reviews.text: It took a few minutes to figure out the poorly translated instructions but the locks work as intended. They are not going to stop a real thief but rather will stop a luggage handler from quickly grabbing something from your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use. Easy to set the code to what you want. And the flexible cable "neck" is ideal for tough spaces. I have a toolbox with a deep plastic slot where a lock should fit but doesn't. THIS lock does.
customer_reviews.author: Kasee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for travel locks... 2 are good to have
customer_reviews.text: Good deal, easy to program, easy to use, great for luggage & lockers. 2 are great for traveling to either have a spare or 1 for luggage and 1 for locker or 1 for luggage and 1 to lock something else to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good luggage lock
customer_reviews.text: The cable gives a bit more flexibility to these locks compared to a regular lock. Combination was easy to set and the locks are easy to lock and unlock. The extra length provided by the cable unable to attach the lock to a non moving part of the luggage preventing someone with ill intention to mess around with the zipper, sliding it around in a attempt to open up the luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Patrik

customer_reviews.title: Long enough lock feature for all my bags
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned that it wasn't going to be able to loop through multiple pockets / storage on my luggage, it DID. These are great and secure. Just did go through TSA in Mammoth Lakes and the bottom thing that is supposed to let you know if they checked it wasn't depressed, a little concerning but other than TSA wouldn't worry about others breaking into it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sutfin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use travel lock
customer_reviews.text: Easy to change combination from default. Once open you need to press side button to re/insert cable and lock by moving dials. The thickness of cable might be too thick for some zippers but the length lets you snag several adjacent zippers as desired.
customer_reviews.author: dztoy1

customer_reviews.title: Solid lock, but great as a deterrent only
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid sturdy wire... could be cut it needed, use as a deterrent. Be careful when setting the code at the start, if you screw up then you wasted the lock. Good thing it is a two pack.
customer_reviews.author: VirtualHalo

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: These locks are great, and can be used on almost anything. You can double loop the cables on one lock to tighten up the item that is being locked. The are simple to use and if they don’t work correctly it’s because you got one that had malfunctioned. I have had no trouble with these or with the reset button problem different people have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: J Duke

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great locks, they do exactly what they're supposed to do in terms of securing luggage for travel. It is very easy to change the combinations as well. I've used them on my overseas trips and have flown over 6 times with these locks. No issues whatsoever so far and I know my luggage has been inspected so these definitely are TSA approved.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for me while traveling internationally. I was able to lock both the main compartment and the upper compartment with just one lock because of the long loop. It worked perfectly. My husband wound up using the other one.
customer_reviews.author: ElaineL

customer_reviews.title: Wasted purchase...will not re-lock
customer_reviews.text: Wasted purchase could not get these locks to work! Got them for a lengthy trip to Europe and traveling on trains between countries.once they were opened,they would not relock and it seemed like the reset button was stuck.Upon my return home I found out my 30-day window has expired for returning these locks. Very disappointed as they never were used. Cannot rate security because I wasn't able to form an opinion as they were not usable.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Gaga

customer_reviews.title: Luggage locks work, but not so well for me
customer_reviews.text: The first lock I tried to program didn't go well - I got it to open once, but subsequent attempts were not successful. I was extra careful with the second lock and it operated fine. I then had the unfortunate surprise that my luggage zippers were not sized to accept the cable. Not ready to buy new luggage - so the locks stayed home.
customer_reviews.author: Donna LaFleur

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: These were difficult to program. The lead is too long. Apparently on our way home the lead caught on something and it was torn completely off our luggage, along with zipper pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pieces of crap
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. One came broken the other we couldn't reset. If I could give zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I don't travel by air very often, but I went on vacation in June and knew that the lame little brass padlocks that came with the luggage I bought for my last vacation (which was in 1995) were not going to pass muster with the new normal at the airport. The locks are robust, priced right, and setting a custom combination was easy.
customer_reviews.author: cheeflo

customer_reviews.title: Locked Out!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these locks for a trip scheduled in the fall. One of the locks worked well, the other would not reset combination selected. Extremely, disappointed with this purchase. I do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: Great Locks
customer_reviews.text: We have used these on luggage’s and our tent door during festivals. Easy to use. (I’m pretty sure this makes TSA in checker baggage even more likely to look in your bag... but hey atleast it’s not unlocked the whole time?)
customer_reviews.author: ElectricZepp

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Items great once I got it to change lock combos. You need to push in pretty far to get it to reset, which took awhile to figure out. I went to put it on my travel backpack and it does not fit through the holes of my zipper so really lock it up. That was disappointing as that’s the only reason I bought them. Oh well, I can use them for the gym I guess! Otherwise a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nicole

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: The locks are sturdy, 100% compatible to ALL of my luggages including laptop roller. It is very easy to reset the combination to my specifications. I highly recommend this product. In fact, I used one of the locks for my main electric control panel as it is located on the outside of my building and another for my fence hinge door lock - a perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: Ming Aquila

customer_reviews.title: Not very secure
customer_reviews.text: Item just as described and it was extremely easy to reset the combination. That is the problem. Anybody that knew the simple trick could reset the combination in 30 seconds and open the lock. The locks are very secure against the average person but not at all secure against the pro thief.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: These are great locks! Much better than the similar product by Master because there is a chain release button on the side. I did not use these for luggage but rather for a cabinet I wanted to secure. The chain is longer on this lock, so it fit my needs perfectly. The Master product has a much shorter chain.
customer_reviews.author: diamondgirl85

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these type of locks before, with the cable loop on top, and they are SO practical and versatile, especially for today's newer luggage types that have many different zippers that need to be secured. These were high quality, easy to set the personal combination, etc. The price was reasonable, too, less than I had paid on other sites like ebags.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Glad to find locks to use on luggage that are gov't accepted. They worked out perfectly. Take your time when setting combination, it's easy to make an error, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy lock(s), too long for a Pelican 1510
customer_reviews.text: VERY STURDY! These were bought to be used with a Pelican 1510 case. However the cables are too long and leave too much "wiggle" room. (When locked the cable loop is about 2.5-3in.) I'm still going to use them with other cases I have that need good locks so they won't go to waste! Again, good sturdy lock(s), worth buying for the right application.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: These came promptly and it was very easy to set the combination
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed. I am not using them for luggage, but to lock up valuable equipment in classroom cabinets. I needed something with a large clasp to go around the cabinet handles. These came promptly and it was very easy to set the combination. I've got several staff that use them, and no one has had any trouble getting them open and locked again. I have already ordered two more sets.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 2 pack of these locks for my kids backpacks. The first one I set works fairly well, although it's sticky. The second one won't unlock. I set it the same way and it will not unlock. I have used these types of locks before so I know how to set them. This one is just broken. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not great
customer_reviews.text: It seemed sensible and good quality, but the first one somehow broke off the bag somewhere in security. I assumed the bag was inspected but there was no notice in there, so TSA wouldn't have cut it off.
customer_reviews.author: whitiglil

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We took these on our two week European trip per recommendation by my brother. Very easy to set the codes and a smooth unlocking system. We used them on our backpacks and never had an issue getting them on and off very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lando

customer_reviews.title: Improved
customer_reviews.text: This isn't much of a review, as I just got them (Oct '18), but I got locks with "Indicating Poles" (between the cables). They (supposedly) pop up when TSA opens the lock with their key. This isn't in the description, so it seems I got improved locks.
customer_reviews.author: JimPL

customer_reviews.title: Love these locks
customer_reviews.text: I have had these type of locks for my suitcases prior to my purchase of these. I use them on many different things. Especially the carry on suitcases that have a zipper with out a lock. Plus I have used them on my coolers that have zippers too. The locks were very easy to set to what combo I want.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: We used the locks for a boy scout foot locker used for camping. It was perfect as the it wasn't heavy like regular padlocks, secured the fottlocker perfectly and was easy for my son to unlock.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Felix

customer_reviews.title: Setting combo doesn’t work properly
customer_reviews.text: I reset the combo before traveling. Unlocked and locked with new combo several times just to make sure I did it right and was ready to go. The next morning the combo wouldn’t work at all. So frustrating when you’re trying to get out the door to the airport. Ended being of no use.
customer_reviews.author: Breianne D

customer_reviews.title: inoperable
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these as one would not even open after several attempts. One did work, so I did set them up correctly. Upon trying to open the second one again, it would not unlock so back they went. The "set" button you were to depress would not engage.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely GREAT Lock!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this! Selected my own combination! Can change combination if you choose. Light, but strong. Fits well on my footlocker. Plus you get 2 locks for a very reasonable cost!! Even better!
customer_reviews.author: OldGirlScout

customer_reviews.title: Resetting your code is very difficult.
customer_reviews.text: The locks are not easy to reset your code. The first lock worked fine. The second one won't take the new code. So now we have no lock for our second suitcase. Not good. We should have tried these locks when they arrived. I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Durable lock- easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for the quality of lock. Super easy to set and unlock. I’ve purchased 16 units and they all work flawlessly! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. Arndt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pelicans!
customer_reviews.text: I traveled around the world with these and they came in handy. Easy to use and durable. I do wish they were a bit shorter, but that’s not a huge issue. I highly recommend these. I use them on my pelican case that I use for my camera equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Agra91

customer_reviews.text: I liked this for the daughter's highschool locker with very small lock openings. Did the job great. Unfortunately only one of the two worked.
customer_reviews.author: carpoozie22

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: Just lost the old lock and decided to buy two. They do lock and unlock. Not sure why it happens to others but they work as they should. Will see if they last.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L.

customer_reviews.title: TSA didn't search our bags which I feel like they usually do
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my travel to Costa Rica, TSA didn't search our bags which I feel like they usually do. I also use these for locking my tent when I go camping. Easy to set the combination and feels well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Grady

customer_reviews.title: Can't reset or start second time.
customer_reviews.text: Negative one!! I attempted to set my code in lock. Dial hard to turn and reset. Should have four hands. Needless to say, didn't succeed and now no way to start over. Very disappointed with order and return window passed. Oh well....just will use zip ties and pray Europe airports cooperate.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Portable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I use it daily for my school gym and I love this one because it’s not bulky so I could carry it on my backpack and it’s only 3 digits. Definitely not easy to break open.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Talavera

product_meta.title: TSA Approved Luggage Travel Lock, Set-Your-Own Combination Lock for School Gym Locker,Luggage Suitcase Baggage Locks,Filing Cabinets,Toolbox,Case
feature_bullets: TSA Accepted - Can be unlocked and relocked by TSA agents without having to break the lock open.
No Key to Lose - The keyless combination lock is easy to set and use.
Resettable to 1,000 Possibilities - Set a combination that you won’t forget from 1.000 possible combinations.
Prevent the Grab-and-go Theft - Keep your personal possessions, like tablets, phones or valuables, safe and secure in many situations.
100% Satisfaction Guarantee - Backed by BV 30 days Money Back Guarantee with 3 years free replacement warranty.
